summary: The "biscuit factory" concept falls under the category of agri-foodstuffs within EU legal and regulatory frameworks. This facility is involved in the production of traditional foodstuffs, which may include renowned products like belokranjska pogača and gibanica. Such items can be granted protection under EU designations, including Protected Geographical Indications (PGI) and Traditional Specialities Guaranteed (TSG). The lawful production of these biscuits must adhere to specific regulations, ensuring that the name and origin are accurately represented. Applications for protection are submitted to the EU, and upon receiving a statement of objection, the functioning of the register is crucial for safeguarding these economically significant products.
